overview: This subject introduces students to Romance-language lyric repertoire from the classical vocal tradition, focussing on musical and textual analysis, performance practice and interpretation. Students analyse texts and scores of Italian, French and Spanish art songs and other lyric repertoire in their historical, musical, and literary contexts. The practical component enables students to apply analytical skills to performance and to develop stylistically authentic and effective interpretations. Coaching and peer interactions establish a positive and collaborative ensemble environment.
ilo: analyse texts and scores of standard Romance-language lyric repertoire in their historical, musical and literary contexts;
analyse the relationship between text and music in Romance-language lyric repertoire;
prepare and perform pieces from the Romance-language lyric repertoire, demonstrating musical style, authentic pronunciation, and effective interpretation;
work constructively and collaboratively with tutors and peers to improve performance.
generic_skills: model respect for truth and intellectual integrity, and for the ethics of scholarship;

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Mid-semester performance of Romance-language lyric repertoire in Italian, French and Spanish. (5 minutes)
Performance of Romance-language lyric repertoire in Italian, French and Spanish. (5 minutes)

assessment.hurdle: 100% attendance is expected. Less than 80% attendance will result in a Fail.

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours comprising one 2-hour workshop class per week.
